page.title: 16Mill Farm
page.content: A hundred years ago near the place where Mill Farm is today there was a mill that ground corn.There are still remains of the site of the old mill that was in use over a hundred years ago. A hundred years ago the mill was owned by a family called the Marshalls who farmed 60 acres. The Howitts live on the farm today the land has increased to 400 acres. The land is used for cattle, there are about 200. After two years of fattening up they are sold on Doncaster market. Half of the land is for grazing and the other half is for wheat and barley to feed the cattle. They own Parson's Carr, no one lives there now although it has been inhabited by farm labourers. The only things staying there now are the cattle. They fertilize the grass with shell and drain the land with ditches.
